_comment.1: If Postgres writer is used to store output, either provide `ConnectionString` or `Host`+`Database`+`Username`+`Password`. If `ConnectionString` and individual parameters are provided at the same time, individual parameters will override respective values in connection string
_comment.2: `DatabaseName` is where output should be stored (database will be created if does not exist).
_comment.3: `ServiceDatabaseName` must always be specified - this is the database LogShark will log into in order to create output database if necessary. For most PostgreSQL instances the service database is named `postgres`
_comment.4: Most of the values can also be specified through command line parameters. In this case command line values override values from this file
_comment.5: `ConnectionTimeoutSeconds` parameter defines how long driver will wait for initial response from the database. It does NOT affect how long we wait for query results

_comment.1: If publishing results to Tableau Server is enabled, provide URL, Site, Username and Password for the Tableau Server to publish results to.
_comment.2: Username and Password can be specified through command line parameters. In this case command line values override values from this file
_comment.3: There are two timeout settings: generic 'Timeout' and 'Publishing Timeout'. The latter only applies to the publishing step and usually set higher because Tableau Server can take a while generate thumbnails when large workbooks is being published
_comment.4: If `Id` or `Name` for the `ParentProject` is specified, LogShark will nest output project under the specified project, otherwise output project will be saved in the root of the site. `Id` takes precedence over `Name`

_comment.1: 'PluginsToRunByDefault' can be used to specify the list of plugins to run when 'All' plugins requested or when --plugins is not specified.
_comment.2: This should be a semicolon separated list of plugin names, no spaces (i.e. 'Apache;Backgrounder'). Leave empty to use all available plugins by default
_comment.3: Plugins listed in 'PluginsToExcludeFromDefaultSet' will be excluded when 'All' plugins are requested for the run. Same format as 'PluginsToRunByDefault'
